name: Ziphelp Package
summary: Learn about .ZHELP files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: EC Software created the Ziphelp format to provide software developers with a new, cross-platform method for packaging and deploying online help documentation. Each Ziphelp documentation package, or ZHELP file, is a standard ZIP file that contains:
A sitemap XML file, extending using custom Ziphelp tags and functionality
To create ZHELP files, developers primarily use EC Software Help+Manual. Developers can also use Embarcadero Delphi to create ZHELP files and integrate those files into Delphi applications.

instructions: You can open a ZHELP file with EC Software eWriter Viewer (Windows, Mac), to view the help documentation the file contains.
If you want to extract and edit a ZHELP file's contents, you can rename the file to use the .ZIP extension and open it as you would any ZIP file.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
